lexUnit.name: wanting.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: lacking in something required, necessary, or usual

sentence.text: Soon he would n't be wanting a live-in housekeeper .
At the end of summer , her body stops wanting gin and tonics and suddenly desires whisky .
But at least they were united in wanting story and more story , and their worldly success suggested that by the 1950s the world was on their side .
However , the sophisticated technology required for rapidresponse policing can sometimes be found wanting in Easton .
` Would ye be wanting a donkey stone , sir ? " she asked coquettishly , stepping without thought into her evening role .
This type of power tool has always been a popular ` first buy " for d-i-yers wanting a powered saw .
If you ca n't wait for a new model , the Black & Decker Woodworker is ideal for the beginner , or for those wanting a second router for lots of small repetitive tasks .
The Sudbury man was not forthcoming , he had been suspicious , wanting all sorts of information about them and the glasses .
` Llanelli was a setback , and we are not sure of our best Test side , but we will not be wanting in confidence . "
Wednesday wo n't be found wanting in the Premier League , says their absentee playmaker John Sheridan .
For kicks , she climbs mountains and skis , so she is not left wanting for adventure .
But then against Clare they flattered to deceive and were ultimately found wanting in the second-half , prompting manager Peter McGrath to question the attitude of many of his squad .
In fact the conditional theory adopts some of the best points of several of the theories found wanting in the previous chapter .
The familial links are not wanting in the poetry either .
Farriery was wanting in that fundamental science .
Ken did n't want to be thought wanting by people for whom he had respect .
When she arched wildly against him , he cupped his hand there , and she felt the heat of his wanting in his fingertips .
Science , for Freud , involves an open-mindedness , and a preparedness to discard ideas and theories if they are found wanting in the light of later research work .
In the end , I am a better woman , for my values are secure , they have been tried and not found wanting .
Vincent 's work was found wanting -- when it was noticed at all -- by a sniffing , word-of-mouth criticism that condemned him as too literary .
Bond Street had been looked over and found wanting : the clothes not displayed as they should be , the new vendeuse lacking in charm .
` Every weekend I get a rush of Indians wanting 1 notes for weddings , " he said .
Gough , writing from a Marxist perspective , finds the de-industrialisation thesis wanting on two counts .
